pullrequest.title: New parsing framework, drop the 2, parity basis

content.raw: I think on this problem, all the timesteppers are probably fairly equivalent.  However, when writing new problems I think people often modify existing example problems.  I did exactly this when I started running the fully compressible kelvin-helmholtz problem.  The issue with SBDF3 is that it's unstable when you try to implicitly step over things (in my case, sound waves).  So I think it might be safer for people experimenting with these scripts to have the default be a more robust timestepper.  Even SBDF2 is much better I think.
